title: Green Savior or Deadly Menace? Paris Votes on E-Scooter Ban
description: For five years, the French capital has permitted the renting of electric scooters, which have proven both popular and perilous. On Sunday, voters will decide whether to end the experiment.

title: Bring the Kids Along
description: We take our children on vacation to expose them to history, novelty and beauty.

title: Far-Left Canadians Susceptible to Russian Influence Too
description: Researchers found that on Twitter, members of Canada’s far left joined those on the far right in embracing pro-Russian messages created by a two-year Russian influence campaign.

title: Russia Pounds Eastern Ukraine but Hasn’t Secured Decisive Breakthrough in Offensive
description: The eastern town of Avdiivka, which has been under assault since Moscow launched its full-scale invasion more than a year ago, bore the brunt of the latest attacks.

title: Venice Is Saved! Woe Is Venice.
Thailand’s Unemployed Elephants Are Back Home, Huge and Hungry
description: When the tourists who rode them disappeared from resort destinations, Thailand’s captive elephants, and their owners, went back to their birth villages, where finding enough food has been a struggle.

title: Why Is Finland the Happiest Country on Earth? The Answer Is Complicated.
description: The Nordic nation has been ranked the happiest country on earth for six consecutive years. But when you talk to individual Finns, the reality is a bit more complicated.

title: China Draws Lessons From Russia’s Missteps in Ukraine
description: With an eye on a possible conflict over Taiwan, analysts have scrutinized the war for insights ranging from the importance of supply lines to the power of nuclear threats.

title: Security Force or Anti-Arab Militia? Israelis Feud Over Far-Right Plan
description: The far-right security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, wants to create a national guard that he would control, saying it is needed to guarantee Israel’s security.

title: Pope Francis Returning to Vatican After Hospital Stay
description: The 86-year-old pontiff spent three days undergoing treatment for bronchitis as a hospital in Rome.

title: Inside Saudi Arabia’s Global Push for Nuclear Power
description: Despite qualms in Washington, Saudi officials have pressed the United States to help them develop nuclear power. But they are also exploring other options, including China.

title: Gift of a Stethoscope to a Refugee Child Inspired a Career of Caring
description: Waheed Arian fled the war in Afghanistan when he was a teenager. Now an emergency room doctor in Britain, he has made it his mission to bring hope and healing to others.

title: Israeli Police Fatally Shoot Arab Outside Jerusalem Holy Site
description: Officers killed the man early Saturday outside the Aqsa Mosque compound, known to Jews as the Temple Mount. The killing risks raising tensions during Ramadan.
